items._description: A mysterious stone, said to be made of crystallised life energy.
A gem that's said to have come from a rock that fell from the sky.
This sliver of a gem is very light, almost without substance. It seems to be made from crystallised ectoplasm.
Candriathope is basically will in physical form. Whenever sentient beings show great devotion to a cause, or great mental discipline, candriathope crystallises somewhere in far-off mountains.
Viper's Eye is a green gem with a distinct black streak that makes it resemble a staring reptilian eye. It's said to be formed when quartz is infused with magical poison.
A coloured variety of quartz, usually used to adorn jewellery or armour. It's superstitiously believed to protect from intoxication, but this has never been proven in the slightest.
This gemstone seems to have no weight at all...
This gem sparkles with a myriad beautiful shades of green.

Being a form of beryl, aquamarine is related to emeralds. However, whereas emeralds contain earth-elemental essence, aquamarine is brimming with the essence of the water element. It feels somehow wet...
A variety of opal that glows orange, due to being instilled with raw fire elemental essence. It is warm to the touch.
A rather rare gem that's said to be the crystallised soul of some ancient creature that lived before the world began. While this may not be at all true, turquoise gems do contain the aAether element.
A common but powerful gemstone that's said to be the crystallised blood of a warrior of some ancient race, slain in some horrendous bloody battle in the distant past.
Onyx is a type of black gem imbued with the power of Darkness. They're common, so they aren't worth much. They contain the potential of Destruction.
Moonstones are quite common, so they aren't very valuable. However, they contain the potential of Healing, and the Light element.
Sapphires are corundum gems of any colour other than red, the most popular and powerful colour being deep blue. They're mystically associated with mind and spirit, magic, intellect, water.
Emeralds are rather valuable green gemstones, a variety of the mineral beryl. They're mystically associated with vitality, constitution, health, earth.
Rubies are extremely valuable red gemstones, a variety of the mineral corundum. They're mystically associated with strength, passion, power, fire.
